/**************  A  L  G  O  R  I  T   H  M   **************/
/*  1. choose middle block of top row & assign a number.
	2. go always up & turn right. Write next number.
	// top most right most block will go to downmost leftmost block.(go up and turn right).
	3. If there is already a number in that, then go down and wrie next number.
	4. Again up & right. If(a number already) godown
	5. continue this until matrix is filled.
*********************************************************/	

#include<bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
 
void gdown();
void uprt();
void dnlt();
void sexy();// set x and y
void write(int);
int check();
int box[100][100];
int a,b,n,no,p,q;
 
int main(){
	int i,j,exit;
	
	n=3; no=15;
	a=0; b=(n-1)/2;
	
	box[a][b]=no;
	
	while(no<25)
	{
		no++;
		uprt();
		while(box[a][b]!='\0')
		{
		 a=p;
		 b=q;
		 gdown();
		}
		write(no);
	}
	
	for(i=0;i<n;i++)
		{
			for(j=0;j<n;j++)
			printf(" ",box[i][j]);
			printf("\n");
		}
	return 0;
}
 
void gdown(){
// just  go down
a+=1;sexy();
}

void uprt(){
// go up and turn left
a-=1;b+=1;sexy();
}

void dnlt(){// go down and turn left
a+=1;b-=1;sexy();
}
 
/* Travelling in the matrix for perfect co-ordinates
   This function will take care of boundaries*/
void sexy(){
if(a<0 && b<n) a=n-1;
else if(a>=0 &&  b>=n)	{b=0;}
else if(a<0 &&  b>=n)	{	a=n-1;	b=0; }
}
 
void write(int no){
	p=a;    q=b;
	box[a][b]=no;
}
